> [...] Or your own custom TestRunner (the best solution)

if you don't want to reinvent the wheel and want a Runner that's a 
little bit more extendable than the standard JUnit runner, you can try 
the JUnit-addons Runner.  Not finished yet but you can run your tests 
with it (and define your own custom listeners and external resources).

I suggest that you check out the cvs version.

Everything is available at <junit-addons.sf.net>

-Vladimir
